duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide complex administrative support to an individual, office, department or program under general supervision.
Edit, format, and revise a variety of documents and materials created by others. Proofread for errors and convert rough drafts to final version quality reports, presentations, and documents.
Develop, implement, and maintain paper and electronic filing systems. Create reports as needed.
Research, analyze, and summarize information for reports independently. Communicate findings orally and in writing.
Receive and read incoming correspondence and information. Summarize and prioritize review of correspondence.
Receive and screen telephone calls and visitors. Handle procedural and substantive matters and inquiries.
Make arrangements for travel and perform required administrative follow-up and recordkeeping.
Assist in preparing and administering department budget by updating accounts and running periodic reports.

Act as intermediary for supervisor, interact with officials, staff at all levels and the public. Provide information requiring comprehensive knowledge of institutional policies, procedures, and special departmental issues.
Provide day-to-day administrative support to the Chair, faculty, staff, and students of the Department.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or GED (B.S degree preferred)
